intro: Geniostoma waiolani, commonly known as the Waiolani lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, white to pale pink petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
